title: The $90 Billion Squeeze: What the Triad's Budget Really Means for Your Capture Strategy
description: Two massive funding streams are converging at the exact moment the Pentagon is tearing up its acquisition rulebook. The $40.5 billion Defense Health Program budget sits alongside a brand-new $50 billion Rural Health Transformation Program.

title: The MHS Triad Part 2: The Capability Stack
description: H2F proves the doctrine works. The telehealth landscape they're inheriting. What it all means for contractors, beneficiaries, and the warfighter.

title: The MHS Triad Part 1: Meet the Three Leaders Who Will Reshape Military Medicine
description: Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and Admiral Darin Via. We're calling them the MHS Triad. Together, they're about to transform how we think about military medicine.

title: We're the Department of War Now
description: Executive Order 14347 authorized the Pentagon to use 'Department of War' as a secondary title. This isn't just optics. It's doctrine. Here's what it means for military medicine.

title: The Audit Mandate: Why Everything Has to Work Now
description: DoD must achieve a clean audit opinion by December 31, 2028. Section 1002 of the FY2026 NDAA gives this mandate real teeth: authority to fire or demote SES employees for audit failures.

title: The Oura Disaster: What Wearables Vendors Need to Know
description: The $96M sole-source contract didn't die because WHOOP filed a protest. It died because DHA realized it couldn't audit the data. The next solicitation will require Audit-Ready Data Architecture.

title: Human Performance Optimization: Via's Doctrine Made Real
description: The Army's H2F program is showing 35% reduction in injury volume, 37% fewer suicides, and 23% higher ACFT pass rate. This is Via's Human Weapon System doctrine made real.

title: GenAI.mil: Emil Michael's AI Push
description: On December 9, Michael launched GenAI.mil, putting Google's Gemini for Government on every DoD desktop. 3 million users, right now, at every classification level.
